56  /**
57   * This class abstracts a bunch of operations the HMaster needs to interact with
58   * the underlying file system, including splitting log files, checking file
59   * system status, etc.
60   */
61  public class MasterFileSystem {
62    private static final Log LOG = LogFactory.getLog(MasterFileSystem.class.getName());
63    // HBase configuration
64    Configuration conf;
65    // master status
66    Server master;
67    // metrics for master
68    MasterMetrics metrics;
69    // Persisted unique cluster ID
70    private String clusterId;
71    // Keep around for convenience.
72    private final FileSystem fs;
73    // Is the fileystem ok?
74    private volatile boolean fsOk = true;
75    // The Path to the old logs dir
76    private final Path oldLogDir;
77    // root hbase directory on the FS
78    private final Path rootdir;
79    // hbase temp directory used for table construction and deletion
80    private final Path tempdir;
81    // create the split log lock
82    final Lock splitLogLock = new ReentrantLock();
83    final boolean distributedLogSplitting;
84    final SplitLogManager splitLogManager;
85    private final MasterServices services;

87    public MasterFileSystem(Server master, MasterServices services,
88        MasterMetrics metrics, boolean masterRecovery)
89    throws IOException {
90      this.conf = master.getConfiguration();
91      this.master = master;
92      this.services = services;
93      this.metrics = metrics;
94      // Set filesystem to be that of this.rootdir else we get complaints about
95      // mismatched filesystems if hbase.rootdir is hdfs and fs.defaultFS is
96      // default localfs.  Presumption is that rootdir is fully-qualified before
97      // we get to here with appropriate fs scheme.
98      this.rootdir = FSUtils.getRootDir(conf);
99      this.tempdir = new Path(this.rootdir, HConstants.HBASE_TEMP_DIRECTORY);
100     // Cover both bases, the old way of setting default fs and the new.
101     // We're supposed to run on 0.20 and 0.21 anyways.
102     this.fs = this.rootdir.getFileSystem(conf);
103     String fsUri = this.fs.getUri().toString();
104     conf.set("fs.default.name", fsUri);
105     conf.set("fs.defaultFS", fsUri);
106     // make sure the fs has the same conf
107     fs.setConf(conf);
108     this.distributedLogSplitting =
109       conf.getBoolean("hbase.master.distributed.log.splitting", true);
110     if (this.distributedLogSplitting) {
111       this.splitLogManager = new SplitLogManager(master.getZooKeeper(),
112           master.getConfiguration(), master, this.services, master.getServerName().toString());
113       this.splitLogManager.finishInitialization(masterRecovery);
114     } else {
115       this.splitLogManager = null;
116     }
117     // setup the filesystem variable
118     // set up the archived logs path
119     this.oldLogDir = createInitialFileSystemLayout();
120   }
121 
122   /**
123    * Create initial layout in filesystem.
124    * <ol>
125    * <li>Check if the root region exists and is readable, if not create it.
126    * Create hbase.version and the -ROOT- directory if not one.
127    * </li>
128    * <li>Create a log archive directory for RS to put archived logs</li>
129    * </ol>
130    * Idempotent.
131    */
132   private Path createInitialFileSystemLayout() throws IOException {
133     // check if the root directory exists
134     checkRootDir(this.rootdir, conf, this.fs);
135 
136     // check if temp directory exists and clean it
137     checkTempDir(this.tempdir, conf, this.fs);
138 
139     Path oldLogDir = new Path(this.rootdir, HConstants.HREGION_OLDLOGDIR_NAME);
140 
141     // Make sure the region servers can archive their old logs
142     if(!this.fs.exists(oldLogDir)) {
143       HBaseFileSystem.makeDirOnFileSystem(fs, oldLogDir);
144     }
145 
146     return oldLogDir;
147   }

161   /**
162    * Checks to see if the file system is still accessible.
163    * If not, sets closed
164    * @return false if file system is not available
165    */
166   public boolean checkFileSystem() {
167     if (this.fsOk) {
168       try {
169         FSUtils.checkFileSystemAvailable(this.fs);
170         FSUtils.checkDfsSafeMode(this.conf);
171       } catch (IOException e) {
172         master.abort("Shutting down HBase cluster: file system not available", e);
173         this.fsOk = false;
174       }
175     }
176     return this.fsOk;
177   }

200   /**
201    * Inspect the log directory to recover any log file without
202    * an active region server.
203    */
204   void splitLogAfterStartup() {
205     boolean retrySplitting = !conf.getBoolean("hbase.hlog.split.skip.errors",
206         HLog.SPLIT_SKIP_ERRORS_DEFAULT);
207     Path logsDirPath = new Path(this.rootdir, HConstants.HREGION_LOGDIR_NAME);
208     do {
209       if (master.isStopped()) {
210         LOG.warn("Master stopped while splitting logs");
211         break;
212       }
213       List<ServerName> serverNames = new ArrayList<ServerName>();
214       try {
215         if (!this.fs.exists(logsDirPath)) return;
216         FileStatus[] logFolders = FSUtils.listStatus(this.fs, logsDirPath, null);
217         // Get online servers after getting log folders to avoid log folder deletion of newly
218         // checked in region servers . see HBASE-5916
219         Set<ServerName> onlineServers = ((HMaster) master).getServerManager().getOnlineServers()
220             .keySet();
221 
222         if (logFolders == null || logFolders.length == 0) {
223           LOG.debug("No log files to split, proceeding...");
224           return;
225         }
226         for (FileStatus status : logFolders) {
227           String sn = status.getPath().getName();
228           // truncate splitting suffix if present (for ServerName parsing)
229           if (sn.endsWith(HLog.SPLITTING_EXT)) {
230             sn = sn.substring(0, sn.length() - HLog.SPLITTING_EXT.length());
231           }
232           ServerName serverName = ServerName.parseServerName(sn);
233           if (!onlineServers.contains(serverName)) {
234             LOG.info("Log folder " + status.getPath() + " doesn't belong "
235                 + "to a known region server, splitting");
236             serverNames.add(serverName);
237           } else {
238             LOG.info("Log folder " + status.getPath()
239                 + " belongs to an existing region server");
240           }
241         }
242         splitLog(serverNames);
243         retrySplitting = false;
244       } catch (IOException ioe) {
245         LOG.warn("Failed splitting of " + serverNames, ioe);
246         if (!checkFileSystem()) {
247           LOG.warn("Bad Filesystem, exiting");
248           Runtime.getRuntime().halt(1);
249         }
250         try {
251           if (retrySplitting) {
252             Thread.sleep(conf.getInt(
253               "hbase.hlog.split.failure.retry.interval", 30 * 1000));
254           }
255         } catch (InterruptedException e) {
256           LOG.warn("Interrupted, aborting since cannot return w/o splitting");
257           Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
258           retrySplitting = false;
259           Runtime.getRuntime().halt(1);
260         }
261       }
262     } while (retrySplitting);
263   }
264 
265   public void splitLog(final ServerName serverName) throws IOException {
266     List<ServerName> serverNames = new ArrayList<ServerName>();
267     serverNames.add(serverName);
268     splitLog(serverNames);
269   }
270 
271   public void splitLog(final List<ServerName> serverNames) throws IOException {
272     long splitTime = 0, splitLogSize = 0;
273     List<Path> logDirs = new ArrayList<Path>();
274     for(ServerName serverName: serverNames){
275       Path logDir = new Path(this.rootdir,
276         HLog.getHLogDirectoryName(serverName.toString()));
277       Path splitDir = logDir.suffix(HLog.SPLITTING_EXT);
278       // rename the directory so a rogue RS doesn't create more HLogs
279       if (fs.exists(logDir)) {
280         if (!HBaseFileSystem.renameDirForFileSystem(fs, logDir, splitDir)) {
281           throw new IOException("Failed fs.rename for log split: " + logDir);
282         }
283         logDir = splitDir;
284         LOG.debug("Renamed region directory: " + splitDir);
285       } else if (!fs.exists(splitDir)) {
286         LOG.info("Log dir for server " + serverName + " does not exist");
287         continue;
288       }
289       logDirs.add(splitDir);
290     }
291 
292     if (logDirs.isEmpty()) {
293       LOG.info("No logs to split");
294       return;
295     }
296 
297     if (distributedLogSplitting) {
298       splitLogManager.handleDeadWorkers(serverNames);
299       splitTime = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis();
300       splitLogSize = splitLogManager.splitLogDistributed(logDirs);
301       splitTime = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis() - splitTime;
302     } else {
303       for(Path logDir: logDirs){
304         // splitLogLock ensures that dead region servers' logs are processed
305         // one at a time
306         this.splitLogLock.lock();
307         try {
308           HLogSplitter splitter = HLogSplitter.createLogSplitter(
309             conf, rootdir, logDir, oldLogDir, this.fs);
310           try {
311             // If FS is in safe mode, just wait till out of it.
312             FSUtils.waitOnSafeMode(conf, conf.getInt(HConstants.THREAD_WAKE_FREQUENCY, 1000));
313             splitter.splitLog();
314           } catch (OrphanHLogAfterSplitException e) {
315             LOG.warn("Retrying splitting because of:", e);
316             //An HLogSplitter instance can only be used once.  Get new instance.
317             splitter = HLogSplitter.createLogSplitter(conf, rootdir, logDir,
318               oldLogDir, this.fs);
319             splitter.splitLog();
320           }
321           splitTime = splitter.getTime();
322           splitLogSize = splitter.getSize();
323         } finally {
324           this.splitLogLock.unlock();
325         }
326       }
327     }
328 
329     if (this.metrics != null) {
330       this.metrics.addSplit(splitTime, splitLogSize);
331     }
332   }

334   /**
335    * Get the rootdir.  Make sure its wholesome and exists before returning.
336    * @param rd
337    * @param conf
338    * @param fs
339    * @return hbase.rootdir (after checks for existence and bootstrapping if
340    * needed populating the directory with necessary bootup files).
341    * @throws IOException
342    */
343   private Path checkRootDir(final Path rd, final Configuration c,
344     final FileSystem fs)
345   throws IOException {
346     // If FS is in safe mode wait till out of it.
347     FSUtils.waitOnSafeMode(c, c.getInt(HConstants.THREAD_WAKE_FREQUENCY,
348         10 * 1000));
349     // Filesystem is good. Go ahead and check for hbase.rootdir.
350     try {
351       if (!fs.exists(rd)) {
352         HBaseFileSystem.makeDirOnFileSystem(fs, rd);
353         // DFS leaves safe mode with 0 DNs when there are 0 blocks.
354         // We used to handle this by checking the current DN count and waiting until
355         // it is nonzero. With security, the check for datanode count doesn't work --
356         // it is a privileged op. So instead we adopt the strategy of the jobtracker
357         // and simply retry file creation during bootstrap indefinitely. As soon as
358         // there is one datanode it will succeed. Permission problems should have
359         // already been caught by mkdirs above.
360         FSUtils.setVersion(fs, rd, c.getInt(HConstants.THREAD_WAKE_FREQUENCY,
361           10 * 1000), c.getInt(HConstants.VERSION_FILE_WRITE_ATTEMPTS,
362         		  HConstants.DEFAULT_VERSION_FILE_WRITE_ATTEMPTS));
363       } else {
364         if (!fs.isDirectory(rd)) {
365           throw new IllegalArgumentException(rd.toString() + " is not a directory");
366         }
367         // as above
368         FSUtils.checkVersion(fs, rd, true, c.getInt(HConstants.THREAD_WAKE_FREQUENCY,
369           10 * 1000), c.getInt(HConstants.VERSION_FILE_WRITE_ATTEMPTS,
370         		  HConstants.DEFAULT_VERSION_FILE_WRITE_ATTEMPTS));
371       }
372     } catch (IllegalArgumentException iae) {
373       LOG.fatal("Please fix invalid configuration for "
374         + HConstants.HBASE_DIR + " " + rd.toString(), iae);
375       throw iae;
376     }
377     // Make sure cluster ID exists
378     if (!FSUtils.checkClusterIdExists(fs, rd, c.getInt(
379         HConstants.THREAD_WAKE_FREQUENCY, 10 * 1000))) {
380       FSUtils.setClusterId(fs, rd, UUID.randomUUID().toString(), c.getInt(
381           HConstants.THREAD_WAKE_FREQUENCY, 10 * 1000));
382     }
383     clusterId = FSUtils.getClusterId(fs, rd);
384 
385     // Make sure the root region directory exists!
386     if (!FSUtils.rootRegionExists(fs, rd)) {
387       bootstrap(rd, c);
388     }
389     createRootTableInfo(rd);
390     return rd;
391   }
392 
393   private void createRootTableInfo(Path rd) throws IOException {
394     // Create ROOT tableInfo if required.
395     if (!FSTableDescriptors.isTableInfoExists(fs, rd,
396         Bytes.toString(HRegionInfo.ROOT_REGIONINFO.getTableName()))) {
397       FSTableDescriptors.createTableDescriptor(HTableDescriptor.ROOT_TABLEDESC, this.conf);
398     }
399   }

401   /**
402    * Make sure the hbase temp directory exists and is empty.
403    * NOTE that this method is only executed once just after the master becomes the active one.
404    */
405   private void checkTempDir(final Path tmpdir, final Configuration c, final FileSystem fs)
406       throws IOException {
407     // If the temp directory exists, clear the content (left over, from the previous run)
408     if (fs.exists(tmpdir)) {
409       // Archive table in temp, maybe left over from failed deletion,
410       // if not the cleaner will take care of them.
411       for (Path tabledir: FSUtils.getTableDirs(fs, tmpdir)) {
412         for (Path regiondir: FSUtils.getRegionDirs(fs, tabledir)) {
413           HFileArchiver.archiveRegion(fs, this.rootdir, tabledir, regiondir);
414         }
415       }
416       if (!HBaseFileSystem.deleteDirFromFileSystem(fs, tmpdir)) {
417         throw new IOException("Unable to clean the temp directory: " + tmpdir);
418       }
419     }
420 
421     // Create the temp directory
422     if (!HBaseFileSystem.makeDirOnFileSystem(fs, tmpdir)) {
423       throw new IOException("HBase temp directory '" + tmpdir + "' creation failure.");
424     }
425   }

427   private static void bootstrap(final Path rd, final Configuration c)
428   throws IOException {
429     LOG.info("BOOTSTRAP: creating ROOT and first META regions");
430     try {
431       // Bootstrapping, make sure blockcache is off.  Else, one will be
432       // created here in bootstap and it'll need to be cleaned up.  Better to
433       // not make it in first place.  Turn off block caching for bootstrap.
434       // Enable after.
435       HRegionInfo rootHRI = new HRegionInfo(HRegionInfo.ROOT_REGIONINFO);
436       setInfoFamilyCachingForRoot(false);
437       HRegionInfo metaHRI = new HRegionInfo(HRegionInfo.FIRST_META_REGIONINFO);
438       setInfoFamilyCachingForMeta(false);
439       HRegion root = HRegion.createHRegion(rootHRI, rd, c,
440           HTableDescriptor.ROOT_TABLEDESC);
441       HRegion meta = HRegion.createHRegion(metaHRI, rd, c,
442           HTableDescriptor.META_TABLEDESC);
443       setInfoFamilyCachingForRoot(true);
444       setInfoFamilyCachingForMeta(true);
445       // Add first region from the META table to the ROOT region.
446       HRegion.addRegionToMETA(root, meta);
447       root.close();
448       root.getLog().closeAndDelete();
449       meta.close();
450       meta.getLog().closeAndDelete();
451     } catch (IOException e) {
452       e = RemoteExceptionHandler.checkIOException(e);
453       LOG.error("bootstrap", e);
454       throw e;
455     }
456   }

458   /**
459    * Enable in-memory caching for -ROOT-
460    */
461   public static void setInfoFamilyCachingForRoot(final boolean b) {
462     for (HColumnDescriptor hcd:
463         HTableDescriptor.ROOT_TABLEDESC.getColumnFamilies()) {
464        if (Bytes.equals(hcd.getName(), HConstants.CATALOG_FAMILY)) {
465          hcd.setBlockCacheEnabled(b);
466          hcd.setInMemory(b);
467      }
468     }
469   }
470 
471   /**
472    * Enable in memory caching for .META.
473    */
474   public static void setInfoFamilyCachingForMeta(final boolean b) {
475     for (HColumnDescriptor hcd:
476         HTableDescriptor.META_TABLEDESC.getColumnFamilies()) {
477       if (Bytes.equals(hcd.getName(), HConstants.CATALOG_FAMILY)) {
478         hcd.setBlockCacheEnabled(b);
479         hcd.setInMemory(b);
480       }
481     }
482   }

493   /**
494    * Move the specified file/directory to the hbase temp directory.
495    * @param path The path of the file/directory to move
496    * @return The temp location of the file/directory moved
497    * @throws IOException in case of file-system failure
498    */
499   public Path moveToTemp(final Path path) throws IOException {
500     Path tempPath = new Path(this.tempdir, path.getName());
501 
502     // Ensure temp exists
503     if (!fs.exists(tempdir) && !HBaseFileSystem.makeDirOnFileSystem(fs, tempdir)) {
504       throw new IOException("HBase temp directory '" + tempdir + "' creation failure.");
505     }
506 
507     if (!HBaseFileSystem.renameDirForFileSystem(fs, path, tempPath)) {
508       throw new IOException("Unable to move '" + path + "' to temp '" + tempPath + "'");
509     }
510 
511     return tempPath;
512   }

530   public void deleteFamilyFromFS(HRegionInfo region, byte[] familyName)
531       throws IOException {
532     // archive family store files
533     Path tableDir = new Path(rootdir, region.getTableNameAsString());
534     HFileArchiver.archiveFamily(fs, conf, region, tableDir, familyName);
535 
536     // delete the family folder
537     Path familyDir = new Path(tableDir,
538       new Path(region.getEncodedName(), Bytes.toString(familyName)));
539     if (!HBaseFileSystem.deleteDirFromFileSystem(fs, familyDir)) {
540       throw new IOException("Could not delete family "
541           + Bytes.toString(familyName) + " from FileSystem for region "
542           + region.getRegionNameAsString() + "(" + region.getEncodedName()
543           + ")");
544     }
545   }

563   /**
564    * Delete column of a table
565    * @param tableName
566    * @param familyName
567    * @return Modified HTableDescriptor with requested column deleted.
568    * @throws IOException
569    */
570   public HTableDescriptor deleteColumn(byte[] tableName, byte[] familyName)
571       throws IOException {
572     LOG.info("DeleteColumn. Table = " + Bytes.toString(tableName)
573         + " family = " + Bytes.toString(familyName));
574     HTableDescriptor htd = this.services.getTableDescriptors().get(tableName);
575     htd.removeFamily(familyName);
576     this.services.getTableDescriptors().add(htd);
577     return htd;
578   }
579 
580   /**
581    * Modify Column of a table
582    * @param tableName
583    * @param hcd HColumnDesciptor
584    * @return Modified HTableDescriptor with the column modified.
585    * @throws IOException
586    */
587   public HTableDescriptor modifyColumn(byte[] tableName, HColumnDescriptor hcd)
588       throws IOException {
589     LOG.info("AddModifyColumn. Table = " + Bytes.toString(tableName)
590         + " HCD = " + hcd.toString());
591 
592     HTableDescriptor htd = this.services.getTableDescriptors().get(tableName);
593     byte [] familyName = hcd.getName();
594     if(!htd.hasFamily(familyName)) {
595       throw new InvalidFamilyOperationException("Family '" +
596         Bytes.toString(familyName) + "' doesn't exists so cannot be modified");
597     }
598     htd.addFamily(hcd);
599     this.services.getTableDescriptors().add(htd);
600     return htd;
601   }
602 
603   /**
604    * Add column to a table
605    * @param tableName
606    * @param hcd
607    * @return Modified HTableDescriptor with new column added.
608    * @throws IOException
609    */
610   public HTableDescriptor addColumn(byte[] tableName, HColumnDescriptor hcd)
611       throws IOException {
612     LOG.info("AddColumn. Table = " + Bytes.toString(tableName) + " HCD = " +
613       hcd.toString());
614     HTableDescriptor htd = this.services.getTableDescriptors().get(tableName);
615     if (htd == null) {
616       throw new InvalidFamilyOperationException("Family '" +
617         hcd.getNameAsString() + "' cannot be modified as HTD is null");
618     }
619     htd.addFamily(hcd);
620     this.services.getTableDescriptors().add(htd);
621     return htd;
622   }
